page.title: 16CANAL BRIMSCOMBE STROUD
page.content: {STROUDWATER CANAL}runs along the valley bottom in an Easterly direction from Stroud,through Thrupp, to Brimscombe.The valley is shared with the A419 Cirencester road,the river Frome and the railway line to Swindon. Originally the canal was an important link between the woollen mills and the river Severn with Brimscombe Port a hive of activity.The Thames Severn canal was an extension of the Stroudwater eastwards through the Sapperton tunnel but was never very successful financially.Today many miles of the canal are overgrown and weedbound and one section has had a factory built on top of it.It is still possible for fishermen to have some Coarse sport and it is excellent for seeing little grebe,flycatchers, kingfishers and in 1985 the first sighting of a Cetti's Warbler.
